page.title: 05 The Fire Station
page.content:
Bury Fire Station was built in 1964 and it has two{fire tenders}and one turntable ladder. There are 64 firemen at the station and they work 4 shifts with 16 men on each shift.
You have to be 18 to train as a fireman and you go to Manchester for 3 months to train. Each fireman trains to do everything, from going up the turntable ladder to driving the tender. They all wear special clothes and a helmet so they do not get hurt.
When they are not at a fire the men clean and check the tenders and train to make sure they can cope with all sorts of fires. They do not use the fire pole any more but can be out to a fire within 45-60 seconds of a 999 call coming through the central computer at Salford. Mark Kay age 8
